00028 #include "FFT.hpp"

00030 //
00031 // multi overlap-save filter
00032 // 
00033 namespace filter {
00034   namespace fir {
00035     template<typename T>
00036     class overlap_save {
00037     public:  
00038       typedef std::complex<T> complex_type;
00039       typedef std::vector<T> real_vector_type;
00040       typedef std::vector<complex_type> complex_vector_type;
00041       typedef FFT::FFTWTransform<T> small_fft_type;
00042 #ifdef USE_CUDA      
00043       typedef FFT::CUFFTTransform large_fft_type;
00044 #else
00045       typedef FFT::FFTWTransform<T> large_fft_type;
00046 #endif
00047     private:
00048 
00049       // class for holding filter coefficients and the fft
00050       class filt {
00051       public:
00052         typedef typename boost::shared_ptr<filt> sptr;
00053 
00054         template<typename U>
00055         filt(size_t l,
00056              size_t p,
00057              const typename std::vector<U>& b,
00058              double shift=0., // normalized frequency
00059              size_t d=1)      // downsampling factor
00060           : l_(l)
00061           , p_(p)
00062           , d_(d)
00063           , n_(l_+p_-1)
00064           , shift_(size_t((1.+shift)*n_+0.5) % n_)
00065           , fft_ (n_,     1, FFTW_ESTIMATE)
00066           , ifft_(n_/d_, -1, FFTW_ESTIMATE)
00067           , h_(n_, 0)
00068           , result_(l_/d_, 0) {
00069           assert(l_+p_ > 0);
00070           assert(((p_-1)%d_) == 0);
00071           assert(b.size() < n());
00072           assert((n_%d_) == 0);
00073           assert((l_%d_) == 0);
00074           complex_vector_type in(n(), 0);
00075           std::copy(b.begin(), b.end(), in.begin());
00076           fft_.transformVector(in, FFT::WindowFunction::Rectangular<T>(b.size()));
00077           for (size_t i(0), iend(n()); i<iend; ++i) {
00078             h_[i] = fft_.out(i);
00079             fft_.in(i) = 0;
00080           }
00081           for (size_t i(0), nd(n()/d_); i<nd; ++i)
00082             ifft_.in(i) = 0;
00083           shift_ = (shift_/size_t(v()+.5))*size_t(v()+0.5);
00084         }
00085         ~filt() {}
00086         
00087         size_t l() const { return l_; }                  // Number of new input samples consumed per data block
00088         size_t p() const { return p_; }                  // Length of h(n)
00089         size_t d() const { return d_; }                  // downsampling factor
00090         size_t n() const { return n_; }                  // FFT size
00091         size_t shift() const { return shift_; }          // frequency shift
00092         double v() const { return double(n())/(p_-1.); } // Overlap factor
00093 
00094         double offset() const {
00095           return (shift() > n()/2) ? double(int(shift())-int(n()))/n(): double(shift())/n();
00096         }
00097         typename complex_vector_type::const_iterator begin() const {
00098           return result_.begin();
00099         }
00100         typename complex_vector_type::const_iterator end() const {
00101           return result_.end();
00102         }
00103         const complex_vector_type& result() const { return result_; }
00104 
00105         // performs inverse FFT of (shifted) input and downsampling       
00106         void transform(const large_fft_type& fft) {
00107           const size_t nd(n()/d());
00108           const T norm(T(1)/T(l()));
00109 #if 0
00110           // naive implementation
00111           for (size_t i(0); i<nd; ++i)
00112             ifft_.in(i) = 0;
00113           for (size_t i(0), iend(n()); i<iend; ++i) {
00114             ifft_.in(i%nd) += complex_multiplication_optimized
00115               (fft.out((n()+i-shift())%n()), h_[i]*norm);
00116           }
00117 #else
00118           // optimized loops
00119           const size_t m(n()/nd);
00120           for (size_t j(0); j<nd; ++j) {
00121             complex_type ci = 0;
00122             for (size_t i(0); i<m; ++i) {
00123               ci += complex_multiplication_optimized
00124                 (fft.out((n()+j+i*nd-shift())%n()), norm*h_[j+i*nd]);
00125             }
00126             ifft_.in(j) = ci;
00127           }
00128 #endif
00129           ifft_.transform();
00130           
00131           for (size_t i(0), ld(l()/d()), offset((p()-1)/d()); i<ld; ++i)
00132             result_[i] = ifft_.out(offset+i);
00133         }
00134 
00135       protected:
00136       private:
00137         inline complex_type complex_multiplication_optimized(complex_type c1, complex_type c2) const {
00138           T a(c1.real()), b(c1.imag()),
00139             c(c2.real()), d(c2.imag());
00140           T k1(a*(c + d)),
00141             k2(d*(a + b)),
00142             k3(c*(b - a));
00143           return complex_type(k1-k2, k1+k3);
00144         }
00145 
00146         const size_t        l_;
00147         const size_t        p_;
00148         const size_t        d_;
00149         const size_t        n_;
00150         size_t              shift_;
00151         small_fft_type      fft_;    // fft
00152         small_fft_type      ifft_;   // fft^{-1}
00153         complex_vector_type h_;      // FFT of filter coefficients+padding
00154         complex_vector_type result_; // result
00155       } ;
00156 
00157     public:
00158       overlap_save(size_t l, // Number of new input samples consumed per data block
00159                    size_t p) // Length of h(n)
00160         : l_(l)
00161         , p_(p)
00162         , fft_(l+p-1, 1, FFTW_ESTIMATE)
00163         , last_id_(0) {
00164         for (size_t i(0), iend(l+p-1); i<iend; ++i)
00165           fft_.in(i) = 0;
00166       }
00167 
00168       size_t l() const { return l_; }
00169       size_t p() const { return p_; }
00170 
00171       typedef std::map<size_t, typename filt::sptr> filter_map;
00172 
00173       static size_t design_optimal(size_t p) {
00174         size_t n(1);
00175         while (n < p+1) 
00176           n *= 2;
00177         double x     = complexity(n, p);
00178         double x_old = 2.*x+1.;
00179         while (x < x_old) {
00180           x_old = x;
00181           n    *= 2;
00182           x     = complexity(n, p);
00183         }
00184         return n/2;
00185       }
00186       static double complexity(size_t n, size_t p) {
00187         return (n+2.*n*std::log(n)/std::log(2))/(double(n)-double(p)+1.);
00188       }
00189       
00190       typename filt::sptr get_filter(size_t index) {
00191         return filters_[index];
00192       }
00193 
00194       // add one filter
00195       //  * returns a pair of handle (size_t) and the (rounded) mid-frequency of the filter
00196       template<typename U>
00197       std::pair<size_t, double> add_filter(const typename std::vector<U>& b,
00198                                            double_t offset,
00199                                            size_t decim) {
00200         if (b.size() != p_)
00201           throw std::runtime_error("overlap_save::update_filter_coeff b.size() != p_");
00202         typename filt::sptr fp(new filt(l_, p_, b, offset, decim));
00203         filters_.insert(std::make_pair(last_id_, fp));
00204         return std::make_pair(last_id_++, fp->offset());
00205       }
00206       
00207       void proc(const complex_vector_type& in) {
00208         proc(in.begin(), in.end());
00209       }
00210 
00211       void proc(typename complex_vector_type::const_iterator i0,
00212                 typename complex_vector_type::const_iterator i1) {
00213         if (std::distance(i0, i1) != int(l_))
00214           throw std::runtime_error(str(boost::format("overlap_save::proc in.size() != l_ : %d != %d")
00215                                        % std::distance(i0, i1)
00216                                        % int(l_)));
00217 
00218         // copy input data
00219         for (size_t i(0); i<l_; ++i)
00220           fft_.in(p_+i-1) = *i0++;
00221         fft_.transform();
00222 
00223         // for each filter
00224         for (typename filter_map::iterator i(filters_.begin()), end(filters_.end()); i!=end; ++i)
00225           i->second->transform(fft_);
00226 
00227         // save old samples
00228         for (size_t i(0), iend(p_-1); i<iend; ++i)
00229           fft_.in(i) = fft_.in(l_+i);
00230       }
00231       
00232     private:
00233       const size_t l_;
00234       const size_t p_;
00235       large_fft_type fft_;
00236       size_t last_id_;
00237       filter_map filters_;
00238     } ;
00239   } // namespace fir
00240 } // namespace filter
00241 #endif // _OVERLAP_SAVE_HPP_cm110628_
